sensor.gamepad: Allow a player to control a character. Specify button, trigger, or stick, and optionally player.
sensor.keyboard: Allow a player to control a character. Specify which key.
sensor.eyes: React when you see an object depending on type or color. Hills and walls can block sight if you use the line-of-sight(LOS) filter.
sensor.ears: React when you hear an object depending on type or sound. Hearing works through walls.
sensor.bumpers: React when you bump into another object depending on type, color, etc.
sensor.timer: React to a number of seconds passing. Add numbers to make longer times.
sensor.got: React to picking something up depending on type, color, etc.
sensor.scored: React to changes in a score.
sensor.missilehit: React to your shot hitting another object. Good for keeping score, but you can do whatever you want - like turn bots pink by shooting them.
sensor.held: React to being picked up by another object.
sensor.terrain: React to different types of ground.
sensor.water: React to different types of water.
sensor.beamed: React to when a Mars rock type has been beamed.
sensor.inspected: React to when a Mars rock type has been inspected.
sensor.scanned: React to when an unknown rock has been scanned in order to reveal it.
sensor.endofpath: React to when you have reached the end of a path
sensor.always: Do something all the time. Optional.

filter.boku: Kodu is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.bokubot: Kodu is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.me: Only check the bot running this program.
filter.said: Listen for another character to say something. Type in what you want to listen for.
filter.countnone: React when you can't see anything that matches the description. For example, see - blue - none will react when nothing blue is in sight.
filter.flyfish: Flyfish is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.jet: Jet is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.light: The Light is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed. It also lights things up. But you can only have four.
filter.fastbot: Cycle is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.saucer: Sorry, I can't tell you any more. Information about the saucer is classified.
filter.windblimp: Blimp is a flying character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.balloonbot: Balloon is a floating character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.subbot: Sub is a submarine character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.terracannon: Cannon is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.puck: Puck is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.wisp: Wisp is a character you can add to your game and whose behavior can be programmed.
filter.anybot: Look for any kind of bot.
filter.rockLowValueUnknown: An igneous rock that appears unknown until scanned, beamed, or inspected.
filter.rockHighValueUnknown: A sedimentary rock that appears unknown until scanned, beamed, or inspected.
filter.expresshearts: React to a bot showing hearts.
filter.expressflowers: React to a bot showing flowers.
filter.expressstars: React to a bot showing stars.
filter.expressnormal: React to bot that's just acting normal.
filter.expressnone: React to a bot that's just acting normal.
filter.moving: React to a bot only if it's moving.
filter.camouflage: React to a bot only if it's camouflaged.
filter.closeby: Close By causes the character to only pay attention to objects that are close to itself. Far objects are ignored.
filter.faraway: React only to things that are far away.
filter.infront: React only to things in front of bot.
filter.behind: React only to things behind the bot.
filter.toleft: React only to things to the left of the bot.
filter.toright: React only to things to the right of the bot.
filter.over: React only to things higher than the bot.
filter.under: React only to things lower than the bot.
filter.countfew: React when you only see a few of something.
filter.countmany: React only when you see many of something.
filter.clustermany: React only when you see many of something that are clustered close together.
filter.leftstick: React to the left stick on a controller. Good for moving.
filter.rightstick: React to the right stick on a controller. Good for shooting.
filter.abutton: React to the A button on a controller.
filter.bbutton: React to the B button on a controller.
filter.xbutton: React to the X button on a controller.
filter.ybutton: React to the Y button on a controller.
filter.lefttrigger: React to the left trigger on a controller.
filter.righttrigger: React to the right trigger on a controller.
filter.lefttrigger_analog: React to the left trigger on a controller.
filter.righttrigger_analog: React to the right trigger on a controller.

microbit.label: BBC 마이크로빗
microbit.tilt: React to tilt input from the BBC micro:bit.
microbit.leftbutton: React to pressing the BBC micro:bit A button.
microbit.rightbutton: React to pressing the BBC micro:bit B button.
microbit.pin1: Read state of BBC micro:bit pin 0.
microbit.pin2: Read state of BBC micro:bit pin 1.
microbit.pin3: Read state of BBC micro:bit pin 2.

button.left: React to the mouse left button.
button.right: React to the mouse right button.

mouse.hover: React to the mouse hovering over an object or terrain.

gesture.touching: React to an active touch (touch screen).
gesture.rotate: React to the rotate gesture (touch screen).
gesture.swipe: React to the swipe gesture (touch screen).
gesture.slide: React to the slide gesture (touch screen).

guiButton.White: React to the WHITE button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Black: React to the BLACK button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Grey: React to the GREY button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Red: React to the RED button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Green: React to the GREEN button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Blue: React to the BLUE button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Orange: React to the ORANGE button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Yellow: React to the YELLOW button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Purple: React to the PURPLE button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Pink: React to the PINK button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)
guiButton.Brown: React to the BROWN button on the HUD. (Visit world settings to change)

touch.controllerButton_X: React to touching on-screen button X.
touch.controllerButton_Y: React to touching on-screen button Y.
touch.controllerButton_A: React to touching on-screen button A.
touch.controllerButton_B: React to touching on-screen button B.

filter.ArrowKeys: React to the arrow keys on the keyboard.
filter.WASDKeys: React to the WASD keys on the keyboard.
filter.Akey: React to the A key on the keyboard.
filter.Bkey: React to the B key on the keyboard.
filter.Ckey: React to the C key on the keyboard.

filter.PageDownkey: React to the PageDown key on the keyboard.

filter.RightShiftkey: React to the RightShift key on the keyboard.

filter.LeftAltkey: React to the LeftAlt key on the keyboard.
filter.RightAltkey: React to the RightAlt key on the keyboard.
filter.OemSemicolonkey: React to the Semicolon key on the keyboard.
filter.OemPluskey: React to the Plus key on the keyboard.
filter.OemCommakey: React to the Comma key on the keyboard.
filter.OemMinuskey: React to the Minus key on the keyboard.
filter.OemPeriodkey: React to the Period key on the keyboard.
filter.OemQuestionkey: React to the Question key on the keyboard.
filter.OemTildekey: React to the Tilde key on the keyboard.
filter.OemOpenBracketskey: React to the OpenBrackets key on the keyboard.
filter.OemPipekey: React to the Pipe key on the keyboard.
filter.OemCloseBracketskey: React to the CloseBrackets key on the keyboard.
filter.OemQuoteskey: React to the Quotes key on the keyboard.
filter.OemBackslashkey: React to the Backslash key on the keyboard.
filter.F1key: React to the F1 key on the keyboard.
filter.F2key: React to the F2 key on the keyboard.
filter.F3key: React to the F3 key on the keyboard.
filter.F4key: React to the F4 key on the keyboard.
filter.F5key: React to the F5 key on the keyboard.
filter.F6key: React to the F6 key on the keyboard.
filter.F7key: React to the F7 key on the keyboard.
filter.F8key: React to the F8 key on the keyboard.
filter.F9key: React to the F9 key on the keyboard.
filter.F10key: React to the F10 key on the keyboard.
filter.F11key: React to the F11 key on the keyboard.
filter.F12key: React to the F12 key on the keyboard.
filter.Shiftkey: React to any Shift key on the keyboard.
filter.Controlkey: React to any Control key on the keyboard.
filter.Altkey: React to any Alt key on the keyboard.
filter.Windowskey: React to any Windows key on the keyboard.
filter.player1: React only to Player 1's controller. Default is to react to any.
filter.player2: React only to Player 2's controller. Default is to react to any.
filter.player3: React only to Player 3's controller. Default is to react to any.
filter.player4: React only to Player 4's controller. Default is to react to any.
filter.terrain: React to a specific type of terrain.
filter.water: React to a specific type of water.
filter.quartersecond: 1/4 of a second. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._01second: 1 second. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._02seconds: 2 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._03seconds: 3 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._04seconds: 4 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._05seconds: 5 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._10seconds: 10 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._20seconds: 20 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._30seconds: 30 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._60seconds: 60 seconds. Combine with others to add up to larger times.
filter._001point: 1 point. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._002points: 2 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._003points: 3 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._004points: 4 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._005points: 5 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._010points: 10 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._020points: 20 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._050points: 50 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter._100points: 100 points. Combine with others to add up to larger amounts.
filter.random: Make a random number using number tiles. For example, Random - 5 creates a random number between 0 and 5.

color.white: Tests white scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.black: Tests black scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.grey: Tests grey scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.red: Tests red scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.green: Tests green scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.blue: Tests blue scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.orange: Tests orange scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.yellow: Tests yellow scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.purple: Tests purple scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.pink: Tests pink scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)
color.brown: Tests brown scores, which are shown on the scoreboard by default. (Visit world settings to change.)

letter.a: The 'A' score, which is never shown on the scoreboard.
letter.b: The 'B' score, which is never shown on the scoreboard.
letter.c: The 'C' score, which is never shown on the scoreboard.
letter.d: The 'D' score, which is never shown on the scoreboard.

filter.scoreequals: React when a score is equal to a certain number.
filter.scorenotequals: React when a score is not equal to a certain number.
filter.scoreabove: React when a score goes above a certain number.
filter.scorebelow: React when a score goes below a certain number.
filter.scoregteq: React when a score is equal to or goes above a certain number.
filter.scorelteq: React when a score is equal to or goes below a certain number.
filter.healthabove: React when a health goes above a certain number.
filter.healthbelow: React when a health goes below a certain number.

direction.up: React to a game stick pushed upward.
direction.right: React to a game stick pushed rightward.
direction.down: React to a game stick pushed downward.
direction.left: React to a game stick pushed leftward.
direction.clockwise: React to a clockwise rotation gesture.
direction.counterclockwise: React to a counterclockwise rotation gesture.

filter.not: React when the when condition doesn't match.

selector.towardclosest: Move toward whatever you're reacting to.
selector.awayfromall: Move away from whatever you're reacting to.
selector.avoidall: Avoid whatever you're reacting to by keeping a certain distance.
selector.wander: Wander around by picking a random direction. Useful as a last line in the program so you character moves when he's not actively pursuing anything.
selector.cruise: Move in whatever direction you're currently facing.
selector.followwaypoints: Move on a path of a certain color. Default is to move on any path.

reset.world: Resets the game, except for the scoreboard.
reset.score: Resets the scoreboard, or an individual score of you provide a color.

projectile.blip: Blips are rapid-fire projectiles - lighter weight than missiles.
projectile.missile: Missiles are big and not very fast, but are smart enough to track their targets!

modifier.slowly: Move more slowly. Use several times to move even slower.
modifier.quickly: Move more quickly. Use several times to move even faster.
modifier.weakly: Do this more weakly than usual.
modifier.strongly: Do this more strongly than usual.
modifier.strengthnormally: Do this at normal strength. Optional.

angle.low: Do this more weakly than usual.
angle.high: Do this more strongly than usual.

modifier.turnforward: Indicates that movement should not determine facing direction.
modifier.forward: The direction the character is facing.

distance.near: Make the character circle the target more closely.
distance.far: Make the character circle the target in a bigger circle.

modifier.expressnone: Act normal and stop showing anything.
modifier._000point: 0 points. You can specify a color too.
modifier._001point: 1 point. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._002points: 2 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._003points: 3 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._004points: 4 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._005points: 5 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._010points: 10 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._020points: 20 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._050points: 50 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier._100points: 100 points. Use several to add up different numbers. You can specify a color too.
modifier.random: Make a random number using number tiles. For example, Random - 5 creates a random number between 0 and 5.
modifier.health: The number of hitpoints the character has.
modifier.payloadzap: Stuns the target for a few seconds.
modifier.payloadpop: Put the target to sleep until someone else resets its health.
modifier.payloadboom: Make the target disappear with an explosion.

modifier.me: Apply the action to the bot running the program.
modifier.it: Apply the action to the target object.

tower.any: Sounds added for tower defense gameplay.
tower.clam_coin_spit: The majestic sound of a clam spitting a coin out.
tower.enemy_converted: A sound for when an enemy is converted.
tower.enemy_escape: A sound for when an enemy escapes.
tower.place_tower: A sound for when a tower has been placed.
tower.star_collect: A sound for when a star has been collected.
tower.coin_collect: A sound for when a coin hs been collected.

modifier.trackingnone: The missile will fly straight and will not move up or down.
modifier.trackinghoming: The missile will follow the ground and try to fly over hills and walls.

constraint.immobile: Do not allow movement, even when bumped.

modifier.once: The code after DO will only be run once each time the WHEN condition is activated.
modifier.microbit.pattern: Pattern to display on BBC micro:bit display.

actuator.movement: Travel around the world. Explore the options. Different characters have different movement abilities.
actuator.eat: Consume the targeted object, which must be close.
actuator.say: Display a text message, either in a balloon or in a dialog. Use <cr> to split into lines.
actuator.open: Works differently for different characters. Experiment!
actuator.close: Works differently for different characters. Experiment!
actuator.kick: Kick the target, if it's close enough. Can vary strength.
actuator.make: Make another object. Can create basic objects or anything marked Creatable.
actuator.launch: Kick the target, if it's close enough. Can vary strength.
actuator.push: Push a target in a certain direction if it's close enough. Can vary in strength.
actuator.pull: Pull a target in a certain direction if it's close enough. Can vary in strength.
actuator.camouflage: Camouflage the target, making it hard to see.
actuator.uncamouflage: Uncamouflage the target, making it visible.
actuator.express: Express an emotion or show a special effect. Some expressions change the face of the character while others are displayed above the character.
actuator.color: Change the color of yourself or the target object.
actuator.glow: Emit a radioactive glow. Can change color.
actuator.sound: Make a sound! Lots to choose from.
actuator.jump: Different characters can jump different heights.
actuator.watersurface: The Surface action causes underwater characters to rise to the surface of the water.
actuator.waterdive: The Dive action cause underwater characters to dive to the bottom of the water.
actuator.airrise: The Go Up action causes flying characters to rise up into the sky.
actuator.airdrop: The Go Down action causes flying characters to fly down toward the ground.
actuator.switchtask: Change to a different page. Only rules on the current page are applied. Pages are really handy for changing behavior.
actuator.inlinetask: At runtime this will include all the programming from another page here. This is handy for kode that you want on several pages since you can type it in once, and then inline it wherever you need it.
actuator.nextlevel: Load the next level. Useful for multi-level games!
actuator.prevlevel: Loadh the previous level. Useful for multi-level games!
actuator.waterraise: Raise the water level under this object.
actuator.waterlower: Lower the water level under this object.
actuator.setwater: Sets the water type under this object.
actuator.rescale: Changes the object's size scale smoothly.
actuator.rescaleinstant: Sets the object's size scale instantly.
actuator.holddistance: Changes the distance for "held" objects smoothly.
actuator.holddistanceinstant: Changes the distance for "held" objects instantly.
actuator.movementspeedmodify: Sets the movement forward speed multiplier for this actor.
actuator.turningspeedmodify: Sets the turning speed multiplier for this actor.
actuator.beam: Fires a laser beam at a Mars rock type to identify the rock's basic characteristics.
actuator.inspect: Drills into a Mars rock type, harvesting samples for further study.
actuator.scan: Reveals the rock type of unknown rocks in an area around the Rover.
actuator.picture: Takes a picture in first person view.
actuator.damage: Subtract health from either myself or the target character.
actuator.heal: Add health to myself or to the target character. The Heal action causes either the character or the target object to recover from damage. The default is for the target object to heal; the character can be healed by including the "me" modifier. Modifiers can also be used to determine the type and amount of healing points.
actuator.zap: Stun either myself or the target character for a few seconds.
actuator.pop: Causes a bot or myself to be completely disabled until health is reset by someone else.
actuator.boom: Make myself or the target disappear with an explosion.
actuator.vanish: Make myself or the target disappear quietly.
actuator.grab: Pick up the target if it's close enough. You can only hold one thing at a time.
actuator.give: Give whatever you're carrying to the target character. If the target can't hold it, it'll drop.
actuator.reset: Reset an aspect of the game or a character.
actuator.restart: Reset an aspect of the game or a character.
actuator.victory: End the game and show a winning message. If you specify a color we'll show it.
actuator.unscore: Take points away from a score.
actuator.scoreset: Set score to a specific value.

camera.followme: The point of view should follow this character.
camera.ignoreme: Don't worry about keeping this character in view.

microbit.say: Scroll text on the BBC micro:bit display.
microbit.block: Control all the BBC micro:bit lights.
microbit.sequential: Turn on the BBC micro:bit lights sequentially.
microbit.show: Show a patten of lights on the BBC micro:bit LED display.
microbit.setpin1: Set the state of BBC micro:bit pin 0.
microbit.setpin2: Set the state of BBC micro:bit pin 1.
microbit.setpin3: Set the state of BBC micro:bit pin 2.
